channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump finds a ‘solution’ to Greenland crisis, backs off on 10% tariff threats
item.description: Trump has repeatedly said that anything less than controlling all of Greenland is "unacceptable."

item.title: In Davos, Art Makes Humans Part Of The Environment
item.description: At the World Economic Forum's annual meeting, artist and technologist Ronen Tanchum taps AI for an installation that merges real-time climate data and...

item.title: Trump says Europe does one thing right: drug prices. ‘A pill that costs $10 in London costs $130 in New York or Los Angeles’
item.description: The president called out French President Emmanuel Macron on refusing to raise drug prices, and claimed tariff threats make Macron change his mind.

item.title: Why ‘Stranger Things’ Would Have Been So Much Better Without Vecna
item.description: Why removing the villain might have led to a scarier, more mysterious, and emotionally stronger series overall.

item.title: The Walmart C-suite reshuffle shows how the retailer sees itself now: as a tech company
item.description: The retail giant is bolstering its tech cred with a focus on AI and e-commerce, and a major appointment.

item.title: AI Is Redefining What A Company Even Looks Like
item.description: As AI makes it easier to build a company, founders are discovering that building faster is not the same as building well.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra Gets New Release Date Details
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy S26 release date is drawing closer. New leaks reveal the full pre-order schedule, a potential price hike, and Samsung's battery boo...

item.title: Why Coinbase split with Andreessen Horowitz and the crypto industry on a key bill—and what’s next for the Clarity Act
item.description: CEO Brian Armstrong’s move to pull support for a Clarity Act draft risks alienating key political allies.

item.title: OpenEvidence Founder Doubles His Wealth As Medical AI Startup Hits $12 Billion Valuation
item.description: Daniel Nadler, the 42-year-old CEO and cofounder of OpenEvidence, is now worth $7.6 billion as his AI search tool surges in popularity among U.S. doct...

item.title: GameStop shuttering 30 New York locations as part of nationwide closures linked to falling sales
item.description: GameStop is expected to close doors of around 30 New York locations as part of massive nationwide shutdown affecting 470 stores by the month's end.

item.title: The rise of on-demand leadership in the AI economy
item.description: Companies are favoring experienced consultants over permanent roles as judgment becomes more valuable than execution.

item.title: Who has priority now? Why boarding a plane has become so ‘elitist.’

item.title: Miami eyes massive $3B sports economic boost as Trump expected to attend college football championship
item.description: South Florida's ultimate sporting events lineup for 2026 delivers billions in economic impact, positioning Miami as the premier sports tourism destina...

item.title: Airlines have 580 million reasons to like GLP-1 weight-loss drugs, analysis finds
item.description: U.S. airline companies stand to save hundreds of millions each year from Americans losing weight thanks to GLP-1 drugs, according to a new study.

item.title: Americans' paychecks grow stronger as Main Street shows new economic strength

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
